attributes.action: intervene to prevent the closure of UK final salary pension schemes by highly successful companies like IBM, Barclays and Fujitsu
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Staff have paid into final salary schemes for years or decades, in good faith,  with the expectation that their pensions would have defined benefits.  If these benefits are now removed, the "bill" may be picked up ultimately by the UK taxpayer in the shape of state benefits to impoverished pensioners.  We call on the Prime Minister to halt this attack on pensions, and, in so doing, safeguard the financial interests both of loyal company staff and of UK taxpayers.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
